title: Forgetting
description: Explores forgetting as an essential and adaptive process in human memory. Topics include: intentional and unintentional forms of forgetting; the (re)constructive nature of memory; and cases of extreme remembering. Satisfies the senior seminar requirement. Satisfies the senior comprehensive requirement.

conditions.restricted_to_majors: senior psychology and cognitive science majors.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): satisfaction of Entry Level Writing and Composition requirements and PSYC 100. Enrollment is restricted to senior psychology and cognitive science majors.

class_notes: All students - If you completed the prerequisites but get an error message, email your proof of prerequisite material to the department -psyadv@ucsc.edufor approval to enroll.
